com.twcable.gradle.cqpackage

Class AddBundlesToFilterXmlTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradle.api.internal.AbstractTask
      • org.gradle.api.DefaultTask
        • com.twcable.gradle.cqpackage.AddBundlesToFilterXmlTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<org.gradle.api.Task>, org.gradle.api.internal.DynamicObjectAware, org.gradle.api.internal.TaskInternal, org.gradle.api.plugins.ExtensionAware, org.gradle.api.Task, org.gradle.util.Configurable<org.gradle.api.Task>

    public class AddBundlesToFilterXmlTask
extends org.gradle.api.DefaultTask
    A task that will (re)write the filter.xml file with bundle files.

    Generally, this uses the "createPackage" task for its values (see setCreatePackageTask(CreatePackageTask)

    See Also:
    FilterXmlWriter

               throws java.io.IOException

      • getBundleFiles

        @InputFiles
public java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> getBundleFiles()
        The list of bundle files to add to the filter.xml

        The default is "${this.createPackageTask.bundleFiles}"

        See Also:
        CreatePackageTask.getBundleFiles()

      • getInFile

        @InputFile
public java.io.File getInFile()
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Where to find the "source" XML that will be modified with the bundles.

        The default is "${this.createPackageTask.contentSrc}/META-INF/vault/filter.xml"

        If that file is not there, an empty filter.xml is created.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        CreatePackageTask.getContentSrc()

      • setInFile

        public void setInFile(java.lang.Object inFile)
        Where to find the "source" XML that will be modified with the bundles.

      • getOutFile

        @OutputFile
public java.io.File getOutFile()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Where the modified XML will be written.

        The default is "${project.buildDir}/tmp/filter.xml"

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setOutFile

        public void setOutFile(java.io.File outFile)
        Where the modified XML will be written.
